resources.string: This application uses low energy Bluetooth to log encounters between phones with the application installed. \n\nAndroid requires location and Bluetooth access to enable Bluetooth functions for Soterio. Soterio cannot work properly without it.

Data collection 

Your phone will be sharing a unique number with other phones that you come nearby. This number contains no personal identifiable information. At no point is your personal information ever shared with a third party. 

Ensuring privacy 

Phones will never share personal identifiable information. Your name and ID number are stored securely on your phone only. Only the Ministry of Health is able to decode the unique number your phone has received to a person. 

Contact tracing and notifications 

Exposure notifications sent will not contain the identities of the patients whom you might have been in contact with. Nonetheless the notification will tell you the approximate time of the encounter and its duration. 

We are committed to protect your privacy while combating the corona virus.
We need you to allow us to send you notifications so as for Soterio to receive and display notifications from the Ministry of Health of Zimbabwe.
Your phone will be securely and anonymously sharing a unique with other phones around you. This will be a key in alerting you if you have been exposed to a COVID-19 patient.
Authorization by a Health official will be required.
Thank you for helping in the fight against corona virus.
We will send a verification code to this phone number:
This will take you back to the previous screen
We couldn\'t send you a verification code. Please try again
There was a problem connecting to the Ministry of Health server. Please try again.
Android requires location and Bluetooth access to enable Bluetooth functions for Soterio. Soterio cannot work properly without it.
Server is currently busy. Please try again later.
We need to register your phone number before getting started.
Make sure Soterio is active before you leave home or when in public places.
Keep Soterio active when you leave home or are in public places.
To keep yourself and your family safe, wash your hands with running water for at least 20 seconds.
It seems that you have not been in contact with anyone who has recently been diagnosed with COVID-19
You may have been in contact with a COVID-19 patient
It seems that you may have been recently in contact with someone who has tested positive for the coronavirus.
If you feel sick, please call the National COVID-19 response team by clicking CALL below
To keep your family and friends safe, you are advised to self-isolate and monitor your symptoms
